exercises.name: The Hundred
exercises.description: A foundational Pilates exercise that combines breathing, core stability, and endurance. The Hundred teaches controlled breathing while maintaining core engagement and spinal alignment, embodying REGAIN's principle that breathing is the cornerstone of every movement.

variations.name: Modified Hundred (Knees Bent)
technique_cues: Maintain neutral spine throughout, avoid arching lower back
Breathe in for 5 counts, out for 5 counts - breathing is the foundation
Keep shoulders away from ears, maintain shoulder blade stability
Move deliberately with control, no momentum
Focus on core connection before adding movement

variations.name: Standard Hundred
technique_cues: Maintain neutral spine, do not compromise alignment for duration
Sustain controlled breathing pattern - 5 in, 5 out
Keep legs at tabletop position, avoid lowering if form breaks
Move arms with precision, not momentum
If breathing becomes compromised, return to modified version

variations.name: Hundred with Extended Legs
technique_cues: Maintain neutral spine - extended legs increase leverage challenge
Only extend legs if you can maintain proper breathing and alignment
Keep legs straight but not locked, engage quads
Prioritize core stability over leg height
If lower back arches, return to standard version

exercises.name: Roll Up
exercises.description: A spinal articulation exercise that teaches sequential movement and core control. The Roll Up emphasizes the REGAIN principle of holistic body connection, moving the spine segment by segment while maintaining core engagement and proper breathing.

variations.name: Assisted Roll Up
technique_cues: Use strap or hands behind thighs for assistance if needed
Move one vertebra at a time, no rushing
Maintain controlled breathing throughout the movement
Keep chin slightly tucked, avoid pulling with neck
Focus on core initiation, not momentum

variations.name: Standard Roll Up
technique_cues: Initiate movement from deep core, not momentum
Articulate spine sequentially - one vertebra at a time
Maintain neutral pelvis, avoid over-arching lower back
Breathe out as you roll up, in as you roll down
Control the descent - do not collapse or drop

variations.name: Weighted Roll Up
technique_cues: Hold light weight (2-3kg) with both hands
Maintain same precise form as standard version
Do not increase weight if form or breathing is compromised
Prioritize technique and control over load
If alignment breaks, reduce weight or return to standard

exercises.name: Bear Crawl
exercises.description: A quadrupedal movement pattern that develops stability, coordination, and full-body integration. Bear Crawl embodies REGAIN's holistic approach, connecting the entire body through the core while maintaining proper alignment and controlled movement.

variations.name: Standard Bear Crawl
technique_cues: Maintain neutral spine throughout movement
Keep hips level, avoid side-to-side swaying
Move opposite hand and foot together
Keep knees hovering just above ground
Breathe rhythmically with movement pattern

variations.name: Cross-Body Bear Crawl
technique_cues: Reach hand across body to opposite foot
Maintain core stability during rotation
Keep hips square and level
Move deliberately, avoid rushing the cross-body pattern
Focus on core connection during rotation

variations.name: Elevated Bear Crawl
technique_cues: Place hands on elevated surface (box or bench)
Maintain same form principles as standard version
Increased leverage requires greater core stability
Keep shoulders stacked over wrists
Do not compromise alignment for speed

exercises.name: Crab Reach
exercises.description: A posterior chain exercise with rotational component that develops hip mobility, shoulder stability, and core strength. Crab Reach incorporates rotation patterns often forgotten in daily life, while emphasizing REGAIN's principle of connecting the whole body through the core.

variations.name: Standard Crab Reach
technique_cues: Maintain neutral spine, avoid hyperextending lower back
Keep hips elevated and level
Reach arm up and back with control
Keep shoulders away from ears
Breathe deeply, maintain core engagement

variations.name: Single Leg Crab Reach
technique_cues: Lift one leg while maintaining hip height
Keep hips level, avoid tilting to one side
Maintain neutral spine throughout
Focus on stability over range of motion
If form breaks, return to standard version

variations.name: Cross-Body Crab Reach
technique_cues: Reach opposite hand to opposite foot
Maintain core stability during rotation
Keep hips elevated and level
Move deliberately, no momentum
Prioritize alignment and control over reaching distance

exercises.name: Goblet Squat
exercises.description: A lower body exercise that emphasizes postural alignment and core engagement. The Goblet Squat teaches proper squat mechanics while maintaining REGAIN's principle of technique over load, ensuring spinal protection and holistic body connection.

variations.name: Bodyweight Goblet Squat
technique_cues: Hold hands in goblet position at chest
Maintain neutral spine throughout movement
Knees track over toes, avoid inward collapse
Sit back into heels, weight in midfoot
Keep chest up, avoid forward lean

variations.name: Light Weight Goblet Squat
technique_cues: Hold 8-12kg weight at chest level
Maintain same form as bodyweight version
Do not increase weight if form is compromised
Keep core engaged, protect lower back
Breathe out on ascent, in on descent

variations.name: Heavy Weight Goblet Squat
technique_cues: Hold 16-20kg weight, only if form is perfect
Maintain neutral spine - do not compromise for weight
Move deliberately and with control
If breathing becomes compromised, reduce weight
Prioritize technique and alignment over maximum load

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift
exercises.description: A posterior chain exercise that emphasizes hip hinge mechanics and spinal alignment. The Romanian Deadlift embodies REGAIN's longevity principle, strengthening the back chain while protecting the spine through proper technique and controlled movement.

variations.name: Bodyweight Romanian Deadlift
technique_cues: Hinge at hips, not lower back
Maintain neutral spine throughout
Keep slight bend in knees, not locked
Feel stretch in hamstrings, not lower back
Move with control, no momentum

variations.name: Light Weight Romanian Deadlift
technique_cues: Hold 10-15kg weight, maintain perfect form
Keep weight close to body throughout movement
Hinge at hips, maintain neutral spine
Do not round lower back at bottom position
Control the weight, do not let it pull you forward

variations.name: Single Leg Romanian Deadlift with Rotation
technique_cues: Balance on one leg while hinging at hip
Rotate torso as you hinge, reaching opposite hand forward
Maintain neutral spine throughout rotation
Keep hips level, avoid tilting to one side
Focus on stability and control over range of motion
If balance is lost, return to bilateral version
